contentrichtext.text: '''French materialism''' is the name given to a handful of [[France|French]] 18th-century philosophers during the [[Age of Enlightenment]], many of them clustered around the [[Salon (gathering)|salon]] of [[Baron d'Holbach]]. Although there are important differences between them, all of them were [[Materialism|materialists]] who believed that the world was made up of a single substance, matter, the motions and properties of which could be used to explain all phenomena.
